ticket.title: "Segmentation fault ruby 1.8.6" "i686-linux" "patchlevel 230"
ticket.original-body:
When I reported #512, I tried to reproduce the issue in order to provide the full stack trace. Instead I got this: @@@ $ ./script/server -e test -p 2000 => Booting Mongrel (use 'script/server webrick' to force WEBrick) => Rails 2.1.0 application starting on http://0.0.0.0:2000 => Call with -d to detach => Ctrl-C to shutdown server ** Starting Mongrel listening at 0.0.0.0:2000 ** Starting Rails with test environment... ** Rails loaded. ** Loading any Rails specific GemPlugins ** Signals ready. TERM => stop. USR2 => restart. INT => stop (no restart). ** Rails signals registered. HUP => reload (without restart). It might not work well. ** Mongrel 1.1.5 available at 0.0.0.0:2000 ** Use CTRL-C to stop. /usr/local/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/actionpack-2.1.0/lib/action_view/helpers/form_tag_helper.rb:431: [BUG] Segmentation fault ruby 1.8.6 (2008-06-20) [i686-linux]
Aborted $ ruby -v ruby 1.8.6 (2008-06-20 patchlevel 230) [i686-linux] $ @@@
ticket.latest-body:
When I reported #512, I tried to reproduce the issue in order to provide the full stack trace. Instead I got this: @@@ $ ./script/server -e test -p 2000 => Booting Mongrel (use 'script/server webrick' to force WEBrick) => Rails 2.1.0 application starting on http://0.0.0.0:2000 => Call with -d to detach => Ctrl-C to shutdown server ** Starting Mongrel listening at 0.0.0.0:2000 ** Starting Rails with test environment... ** Rails loaded. ** Loading any Rails specific GemPlugins ** Signals ready. TERM => stop. USR2 => restart. INT => stop (no restart). ** Rails signals registered. HUP => reload (without restart). It might not work well. ** Mongrel 1.1.5 available at 0.0.0.0:2000 ** Use CTRL-C to stop. /usr/local/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/actionpack-2.1.0/lib/action_view/helpers/form_tag_helper.rb:431: [BUG] Segmentation fault ruby 1.8.6 (2008-06-20) [i686-linux]
Aborted $ ruby -v ruby 1.8.6 (2008-06-20 patchlevel 230) [i686-linux] $ @@@
ticket.original-body-html:
When I reported #512, I tried to reproduce the issue in order to provide the full stack trace. Instead I got this: 

$ ./script/server -e test -p 2000
=> Booting Mongrel (use 'script/server webrick' to force WEBrick)
=> Rails 2.1.0 application starting on http://0.0.0.0:2000
=> Call with -d to detach
=> Ctrl-C to shutdown server
** Starting Mongrel listening at 0.0.0.0:2000
** Starting Rails with test environment...
** Rails loaded.
** Loading any Rails specific GemPlugins
** Signals ready.  TERM => stop.  USR2 => restart.  INT => stop (no restart).
** Rails signals registered.  HUP => reload (without restart).  It might not work well.
** Mongrel 1.1.5 available at 0.0.0.0:2000
** Use CTRL-C to stop.
/usr/local/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/actionpack-2.1.0/lib/action_view/helpers/form_tag_helper.rb:431: [BUG] Segmentation fault
ruby 1.8.6 (2008-06-20) [i686-linux]

Aborted
$ ruby -v
ruby 1.8.6 (2008-06-20 patchlevel 230) [i686-linux]
$

$ ./script/server -e test -p 2000
=> Booting Mongrel (use 'script/server webrick' to force WEBrick)

version.title: "Segmentation fault ruby 1.8.6" "i686-linux" "patchlevel 230"

version.body: It might be purely a Ruby bug, see http://rubyforge.org/tracker/?func=detail&aid=20902&group_id=426&atid=1698
version.body-html: It might be purely a Ruby bug, see http://rubyforge.org/tracker/?fu...
version.title: "Segmentation fault ruby 1.8.6" "i686-linux" "patchlevel 230"

version.body:
It's a Ruby issue, and it seems to be resolved: http://redmine.ruby-lang.org/issues/show/211
(I'd delete this ticket if I could find a way to do that.)
version.body-html:

http://redmine.ruby-lang.org/iss...
